node.title: WTA threatens to pull tournaments from China if Peng Shuai isn't accounted for
node.alt: China's Shuai Peng serves during her tennis match
node.description: Women's Tennis Association boss Steve Simon says events could be stripped from China if the safety of missing player Peng Shuai can not be assured, as Serena Williams joins the public outcry.
node.content:
["Women's Tennis Association (WTA) chief executive Steve Simon has issued a warning to China amid concerns for the welfare of missing player Peng Shuai.", "The Chinese former doubles world number one alleged\u00a0on social media this month that former vice-premier of China, Zhang Gaoli, coerced her into sex and that they later had an on-off consensual relationship. Her post was deleted half an hour later.", "Beijing has yet to comment on Ms Peng's initial allegation and discussion of the topic has been blocked on China's heavily censored internet.", "Mr Simon\u00a0said he was worried for Ms Peng's safety and had doubts after the WTA received an email, also released by a Chinese state media outlet, in which Ms Peng was said to deny the sexual assault allegations.", "\"The WTA and the rest of the world need independent and verifiable proof that she is safe,\" Mr Simon\u00a0said.", "\"Peng Shuai must be allowed to speak freely, without coercion or intimidation from any source.", "\"Her allegation of sexual assault must be respected, investigated with full transparency and without censorship.\"", "In an interview with Time Magazine, Mr Simon said there could be repercussions for tennis in China should the country not respond.", "\"Should we find that what we are asking for cannot happen or will not happen, we are prepared to no longer do business within the region and move forward,\" he said.", "", "
Peng Shuai has not been seen since she accused a former Chinese government official of sexual assault.(Reuters:\u00a0Toby Melville)
", "Meanwhile, women's tennis legend Serena Williams has voiced concern for Ms\u00a0Peng.", "\"I am devastated and shocked to hear about the news of my peer, Peng Shuai,\" 23-time Grand Slam winner Williams wrote in a Twitter post.", "\"I hope she is safe and found as soon as possible.\"", "Belgian former world number one\u00a0Kim Clijsters applauded the WTA.", "\"Strong stand by WTA. All of us players, male and female, need to get behind this. We need to know she is safe!\" Clijsters tweeted.", "The International Tennis Federation (ITF) said it supported \"a full and transparent investigation into this matter\".", "\"This must be investigated and we must not stay silent,\" Williams said.", "\"Sending love to her and her family during this incredibly difficult time.\"", "Ms Peng's case has prompted international outrage and concern across global sport, with World Cup winner Gerard Pique also joining the outcry on social media.", "ABC/Reuters"]
